intro: Cylindrolobus arunachalensis, commonly known as the Arunachal Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations, showcasing its adaptation to harsh mountainous environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution in the region.
